sen.j: 駒姫（こまひめ、天正7年（1581年） - 文禄4年8月2日 (旧暦)（1595年9月5日））は、最上義光と大崎夫人の二女で、豊臣秀次の側室。
sen.e: Komahime (1581-September 5, 1595) was the second daughter between Yoshiaki MOGAMI and Osaki fujin and was a concubine of Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI.
Komahime (1581-September 5, 1595) was the second daughter between Yoshiaki MOGAMI and Osaki fujin and was a concubine of Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI.

sen.e: Komahime (1581 - September 5, 1595) was the second daughter of Yoshiaki MOGAMI and Osaki Fujin, and was a concubine of Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: 別名、伊万（いま）。

sen.j: 伊達政宗の従妹に当たる。

She was a cousin to Masamune DATE.

sen.j: 駒姫は、その類いまれな美しさから父母に溺愛されて育ったという。
sen.e: Komahime was amazingly beautiful, and she was raised with plenty of love from her parents.
Komahime was amazingly beautiful, and she was raised with plenty of love from her parents.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 時の関白・豊臣秀次は、東国一の美少女と名高かった駒姫の噂を聞き、側室に差し出すよう義光に迫った。
sen.e: Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI, Kanpaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) at the time heard about Komahime who was famous as the most beautiful girl in Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly Kanto region), and pressed Yoshimitsu to offer Komahime as a concubine to him.

Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI, Kampaku (chief adviser to the Emperor) at the time, heard about Komahime, who was famous as the most beautiful girl in Togoku (the eastern part of Japan, particularly the Kanto region), and pressed Yoshimitsu to offer Komahime as a concubine to him.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: Hidetsugu TOYOTOMI, the chief adviser to the Emperor at the time, heard about Komahime having the reputation of the most beautiful girl in the eastern part of Japan, pressed Yoshimitsu to offer Komahime as a concubine to him.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 義光は断ったが度重なる要求に折れ、十五歳になったら娘を山形から京へと嫁がせると約束する羽目に陥る。
sen.e: Although Yoshimitsu kept refusing, he ended up promising to have Komahime marry into Kyoto from Yamagata when Komahime turn fifteen years old.
Although Yoshimitsu kept refusing, he ended up promising to have Komahime marry into Kyoto from Yamagata when Komahime turned fifteen years old.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: Although Yoshimitsu kept refusing, he was consequently forced into promising to have Komahime marry into Kyoto from Yamagata when Komahime turned fifteen years old.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: なお、九戸政実討伐の帰途、山形城に立ち寄った秀次を、義光が駒姫に接待させたという挿話は後世の創作とみたほうが妥当である。
sen.e: In fact, the episode that Yoshimitsu had Komahime entertain Hidetsugu who dropped by Yamagata Castle on the way back from subjugation of Masazane KUNOHE was probably a functional story made up in after ages.

In fact, the episode where Yoshimitsu had Komahime entertain Hidetsugu, who stopped in Yamagata Castle on the way back from the subjugation of Masazane KUNOHE, was probably a fictitious story made up in subsequent ages.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: In fact, the episode where Yoshimitsu had Komahime entertain Hidetsugu, who stopped in Yamagata-jo Castle on the way back from the subjugation of Masazane KUNOHE, was probably a fictitious story made up in later ages.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 文禄4年（1595年）、駒姫は京に到着し、最上屋敷で長旅の疲れを癒していた。
sen.e: After Komahime arrived at Kyoto in 1595, Komahime was in the Saijo residence relieving the weariness of a long journey.

sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: After Komahime arrived in Kyoto in 1595, she was in the Mogami's residence relieving her weariness of a long journey.

sen.j: ところが、七月十五日、秀次は豊臣秀吉の命により高野山で切腹させられてしまった。
sen.e: However, on July 15, Hidetsugi was forced to commit Seppuku (suicide by disembowelment) at Koya-san Mountain by the order of Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI.

sen.j: そして駒姫も、八月二日に他の秀次の側室達と共に、三条河原に引き立てられ十一番目に処刑された。
sen.e: Komahime too was forcibly taken to Sanjo-gawara Riverside with other concubines of Hidetsugu on August 2; she was executed eleventhly.

sen.e: Komahime was also forcibly taken to Sanjo-gawara Riverside with the other concubines of Hidetsugu on August 2, and was the eleventh to be executed.

sen.j: まだ実質的な秀次の側室になる前だったと言われている。
sen.e: It was before Komahime practically became Hidetsugu's concubines.
It was even before Komahime became one of Hidetsugu's concubines.

sen.e: It was even before Komahime virtually became a Hidetsugu's concubine.

sen.j: 父の義光が必死で助命嘆願に廻り、各方面からも処刑せぬようにと声があがった。
sen.e: Komahime's father, Yoshimitsu desperately pleaded for her life visiting various parties, and outcry for saving her life occurred from various parties.
Komahime's father, Yoshimitsu desperately pleaded for her life visiting various parties. There was also an outcry to save her life from various people.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: Komahime's father Yoshimitsu desperately pleaded for her life visiting various quarters, and there was also an outcry to save her life from various people.

sen.j: 秀吉もついにこれを無視できなくなり「鎌倉で尼にするように」と早馬を処刑場に派遣した。
sen.e: It became hard for Hideyoshi to ignore this, Hideyoshi dispatched a post horse to the execution ground to stop to execute her with a order to have her become a priest in Kamakura.
It became hard for Hideyoshi to ignore this, Hideyoshi dispatched a post horse to the execution ground to stop the execution of her with an order to have her become a priest in Kamakura.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: As it became hard for Hideyoshi to ignore this, Hideyoshi dispatched a fast post-horse to the execution ground to stop the execution of her with an order 'to have her become a priest in Kamakura.'
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: しかしあと一町の差で間に合わなかった。
sen.e: But, it was just a little late; when Komahime was killed, the post horse was only a town before.
However, it was too late; when Komahime was killed, the post horse was only one town away.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: However, it was too late; Komahime was killed when the horse was only approximately 109 meters away.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: 享年15。

She died at the age of 15.

sen.j: その従容とした死に様は、さすが大名の娘であるといわしめた。
sen.e: She died so bravely that everybody was impressed with it, saying she was a real daughter of Daimyo (Japanese feudal lord).
She died so bravely that everybody was impressed with it, saying she was the real daughter of a Daimyo (a Japanese feudal lord).
sen.cmt: wording

sen.j: 辞世の句は｢罪をきる弥陀の剣にかかる身のなにか五つの障りあるべき」（慈悲深い弥陀様の剣に斬られる私に、どうして往生できない五つの罪があるのでしょうか）。
sen.e: Her death haiku (Japanese poem) was `I will be killed by the sword of merciful Mida (Amitabha) who brings criminals to justice, and I certainly did not commit any of five sins that kept someone from going to heaven.'

Her death haiku (Japanese poem) was `I will be killed by the sword of merciful Mida (Amitabha) who brings criminals to justice, and I have certainly not commited any of the five sins that prevents someone from ascending to heaven'.

sen.j: この辞世は彼女愛用の着物で表装され、他の処刑者のものとともに京都国立博物館に保存されている。
sen.e: This death haiku (Japanese poem) was covered by her favorite Kimono, and is kept in Kyoto National Museum with those of other executed concubines.
This death haiku (Japanese poem) was covered by her favorite Kimono, and is kept in the Kyoto National Museum with those of other executed concubines.

Its replicas are in Kyoto Zuisen-ji Temple and in Mogami Yoshiaki Historical Museum in Yamagata City.

sen.j: そのむごたらしさに都人は浅ましいとも何とも言いようがない思いを感じたと伝わる。

sen.e: Osaki fujin (lady), Komahime's mother, was filled with sorrow when she heard her daughter's death, and then she passed away in sadness fourteen days after her daughter died.
Osaki fujin (lady), Komahime's mother, was filled with sorrow when she heard of her daughter's death, and then she passed away in mourning fourteen days after her daughter died.

sen.e: Yoshimitsu's fury and grief were very intense, and some people said this tragedy caused Yoshimitsu to join the East squad in the Battle of Sekigahara.

sen.j: さらに慶長3年（1598年）、八町四方の土地と寺領14石を寄進し城下最大の伽藍を建立、敷地に村山地方の真宗寺院十三ケ寺を塔頭として集め、のちに寺町と呼ばれるようになる町を整備した。
sen.e: Besides, in 1598, he donated fourteen koku (a unit of volume) of temple estate, had the biggest Buddhist temple in a castle town built, and gathered thirteen Shinshu sect temples in Muraya area as tatchu (sub-temples in the site of main temple), maintaining the town which would be called as a temple town later.
sen.cmt: 八町四方の土地→定訳・読み共に不明なため訳文には反映していません。
sen.e: In addition, in 1598, he donated fourteen koku (a unit of volume) of a temple estate, had the biggest Buddhist temple in a castle town built, and gathered thirteen Shinshu sect temples in the Muraya area as tatchu (sub-temples in the site of the main temple), maintaining the town which would be called as a temple town later.
sen.cmt: wording
sen.e: In addition, in 1598, he donated approximately eight hectare patch of land and fourteen koku (a unit of volume) of a temple estate, had the biggest Buddhist temple in a castle town built, and gathered thirteen Shinshu sect temples in the Murayama area as tatchu (sub-temples in the site of the main temple), maintaining the town which would be called as a temple town later.
sen.cmt: FBに基づいて修正しました。

sen.j: この寺には、山形城より駒姫の居室が移築されており、大崎夫人像とともに彼女の肖像画が保存されている（なお、広く知られている彼女の肖像画は大正期に描かれたものである。もとの画は尼僧姿のもの）。
sen.e: In this temple, Komahime's room in Yamagata Castle was built in, and her portrait was preserved as well as Osaki fujin's (her well-known portrait was drawn in the Tasho period while the original one was in a priest style).

However, a few of Hidetsugu's wives and children, incidentally, were saved.
